title: Great thankes to the welcome, in Churchyards behalfe to him that hath bleared, and cried like a calfe. Full well by his crying a man may now know, where veale may be bought of a price very low: the head and the purnaunce, with gather though small, as cheape as a shepes head, the hornes bought withall.
author: Smart, Ralph.
publisher: In little Britaine, by Alexander Lacy, for Frauncis Coldocke, dwellyng in Paules churchyarde, at the signe of the gr√©ene Dragon,
notes: Signed: (q[uod]) Ra. Sm., i.e. Ralph Smart.
With reference to: Churchyard, Thomas.  A greatter thanks, for Churchyardes welcome home.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
